item.title: Meghan and Harry interview: I didn't want to be alive any more, duchess says
item.description: In a deeply personal TV interview, Meghan tells Oprah Winfrey that she did not get help when she asked for it.

item.title: Millions back to school in 'first step to normality'
item.description: The big return to school has started, with face masks and Covid tests for secondary pupils.

item.title: Covid-19: Schools back in England, and Covid fines for Rangers fans
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Monday morning.

item.title: Deliveroo boss Will Shu: 'I was never into start-ups'
item.description: Will Shu's comments come as the food delivery firm sets out flotation plans but reports another loss.

item.title: George Floyd death: How will jurors be selected in Derek Chauvin trial?
item.description: The trial of Derek Chauvin over the death of George Floyd puts the US jury system under the spotlight.

item.title: Billionaire Mackenzie Scott marries science teacher
item.description: The ex-wife of Amazon's Jeff Bezos is one of the world's richest women and a major philanthropist.

item.title: Afghanistan conflict: US warns of new Taliban 'spring offensive'
item.description: The militant group could make rapid gains in Afghanistan when US troops pull out, officials say.

item.title: Cladding rules: New guidance to help flat owners stuck in 'limbo'
item.description: The recommendations aim to reduce the number of safety checks banks request on blocks of flats.

item.title: Rangers' Premiership win: 'Anger' over celebrating Rangers fans
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon joins criticism of crowds who gathered to celebrate Rangers' Premiership win.

item.title: Covid: Banksy to auction Southampton hospital artwork for NHS
item.description: The piece depicts a young boy discarding his superhero toys in favour of a model of an NHS nurse.

item.title: Somerset starlings stop man's car in 'impressive' display
item.description: Ecologist Jamie Kingscott took a photograph of thousands of starlings as they surrounded his car.

item.title: Meghan and Harry interview: Racism claims, duke 'let down' by dad, and duchess on Kate
item.description: The explosive interview saw the couple talk about their relationships with other royals and racism.

item.title: The Papers: 'Caution as pupils return' and 'Meghan speaks out'
item.description: Several of Monday's front pages lead with the return to the classroom for many pupils in England.

item.title: The ballerina dancing on ice for a real ‘swan lake’
item.description: Ilmira Bagrautinova from the world-renowned Mariinsky Theatre danced in -15C to save a natural beauty spot.

item.title: Could lab-grown meat help tackle climate change?
item.description: Last year Singapore approved the sale of 'chicken' grown in a lab. What is it exactly - and could it be better for the planet?

item.title: Losing a twin: 'With great love, comes great loss’
item.description: The sister of a girl who died following a school bus crash speaks about how she copes with her grief.

item.title: The women of Egypt's Arab Spring
item.description: Ten years ago, Egyptians took to the streets calling for the overthrow of President Hosni Mubarak

item.title: In pictures: Thousands attend LGBT Mardi Gras in Sydney
item.description: Thousands gathered for the event, which was scaled back over Covid-19 safety concerns.

item.title: Stormont signer's children passing on their skills
item.description: Stormont signer Kristina Sinclair's children use sign language despite not having hearing difficulties.

item.title: The woman with HIV helping others have a 'good death'
item.description: In the country with the world's highest prevalence of HIV, Thembi Nkambule doesn't want people to die of Aids ashamed and alone.

item.title: Naga Munchetty: It’s time to talk about race
item.description: Naga Munchetty travelled across the UK to understand what race and racism means today.

item.title: Coming 2 America: 'The first black fairytale' revisited
item.description: Actress Nomzamo Mbatha on the importance of Coming 2 America "celebrating blackness" on screen.

item.title: 'Deepfake is the future of content creation'
item.description: Deepfake, or AI-generated videos, are increasingly being used commercially.

item.title: London Zoo: Second Easter in lockdown looms
item.description: London Zoo staff explain how they - and the animals - have coped in their most difficult year.

item.title: A year ago, the show did not go on. What happened next?
item.description: Read the stories of those who worked on a play in Liverpool that was cut short by Covid.

item.title: Katy Sprague: The family piecing together an 'avoidable murder'
item.description: Katy Sprague's family believe if their concerns had been addressed she would still be alive today.

item.title: How a ring tells the story of a forgotten secret agent
item.description: A war hero had been all but forgotten. But now his story can be told - thanks to his engagement ring.

item.title: UK Royal Family: Who is in it and how does it work?
item.description: Here are some of the things you need to know about the British royals.

item.title: Prize money 'significantly levelled up' between women's and men's sport
item.description: More sports than ever are offering equal prize money, a BBC study shows on International Women's Day.

item.title: Man City 0-2 Man Utd: It's not a lack of ability that has cost Manchester United the title - Shearer analysis
item.description: Manchester United had the desire and belief to win at Etihad Stadium on Sunday, says MOTD2 pundit Alan Shearer, but Manchester City have shown them what it takes to win the title.

item.title: Teenager Hodgkinson takes 800m gold as GB end Euro Indoors on high
item.description: Teenager Keely Hodgkinson further enhances her reputation by taking 800m gold for Great Britain who end the European Indoor Championships with 12 medals.

item.title: What can football learn from cricket about equal prize money?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the benefits of introducing equal prize money, why it matters to athletes, and what sponsors think.

item.title: 'Gerrard not yet ready for Liverpool despite stellar success at Rangers'
item.description: Former Liverpool player and BBC Sport pundit Mark Lawrenson says Steven Gerrard is still not quite ready to be Liverpool boss, despite his impressive work at Rangers.

item.title: Covid: How will testing work in schools?
item.description: All students in England can now return to classrooms, but how will Covid testing work?

item.title: How could children make up for lost school time?
item.description: A massive task lies ahead for schools as they try to make up for teaching time lost during the pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus, schools and children - what are the risks?
item.description: How much do children contribute to the spread of Covid?

item.title: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: England has entered the first stage of its lockdown easing with millions of children back at school.

item.title: Covid: How are European countries tackling the pandemic?
item.description: Are European countries relaxing restrictions put in place to control a new wave of infections?

item.title: Covid child brides: 'My family told me to marry at 14'
item.description: A Unicef report shows ten million more underage girls may be forced to marry due to the pandemic.

item.title: Lewes FC: The football club that pays women the same as men
item.description: Lewes FC is the only club in the world that pays its women's team the same as its men.

item.title: International Women's Day 2021: History, marches and celebrations
item.description: Everything you need to know about worldwide celebrations taking place on 8 March.

item.title: International Women's Day: Illustrating the Covid-19 pandemic
item.description: These three artists turn complex research into easy to digest information to help fight coronavirus.

item.title: Priyanka Dewan: The roller-skating star who beat disability stigma
item.description: Since taking up skating at the age of eight, Priyanka Dewan has become an international champion.

item.title: 'I've been listening to 300 vinyl records to get me through lockdown'
item.description: Listening to all her records took Anna Doble back to her youth - releasing memories and emotions.
